page.title: 09ARCHITECTURE
page.content: South norwwod is an area of very mixed architecture. The reason for this is that the district has developed over the last hundred years. During the Second World War many houses were bombed and had to be rebuilt. The Victorian villas were large with much decoration, such as large bay windows, and arched windows. They may have fancy iron work on the roof - ridge or long window sills. Some houses in the area have ornamental towers and fancy porches. These Victorian villas are usually set back from the road with large gardens. Houses are of the three-bedroom type and either semi-detached or built in terraces. Rows of streets have identical houses in them. The houses are often gabied and have bay windows, situated near by are parades of shops.
